docs.text: Welcome to JetejaDocs This is the official documentation site for the Jeteja Project. Here, you’ll find everything you need to install, configure, and start using Jeteja. We provide detailed guides for setup, parts, and usage, along with active development updates and demos to help you get the most out of the project. Quick Links Installation Instructions – Step-by-step setup guide. Parts List – Complete list of components and specifications. Getting It Running – Initial run and configuration details. Demos – Explore the project in action. Active Development – What’s currently in progress.
docs.title: Home

docs.text: This is the official documentation site for the Jeteja Project. Here, you’ll find everything you need to install, configure, and start using Jeteja. We provide detailed guides for setup, parts, and usage, along with active development updates and demos to help you get the most out of the project.

docs.title: Quick Links

docs.text: Installation Guide This guide will help you set up the project on your system. Required Software Ensure the following software is installed before proceeding: ROS 2 Humble realsense2_camera ROS 2 package sudo apt install ros-humble-realsense2-camera rplidar ros2 package sudo apt install ros-humble-rplidar teleop_twist_joy package sudo apt install ros-humble-teleop_twist_joy mpremote pip install mpremote Building the Workspace Open a terminal and navigate to your workspace directory: cd ~/jeteja_ws Clone the repository to your workspace directory: git clone https://github.com/AshtonJohns/UCAJetson.git Build the project : colcon build Simplify Access for Future Sessions To automatically source your workspace setup each time you open a terminal, add the following lines to your ~/.bashrc file : source ~/jeteja_ws/install/setup.py source /opt/ros/humble/install/setup.py
docs.title: Installation Instructions

docs.text: This guide will help you set up the project on your system.
docs.title: Installation Guide

docs.text: Ensure the following software is installed before proceeding: ROS 2 Humble realsense2_camera ROS 2 package sudo apt install ros-humble-realsense2-camera rplidar ros2 package sudo apt install ros-humble-rplidar teleop_twist_joy package sudo apt install ros-humble-teleop_twist_joy mpremote pip install mpremote

docs.text: Open a terminal and navigate to your workspace directory: cd ~/jeteja_ws Clone the repository to your workspace directory: git clone https://github.com/AshtonJohns/UCAJetson.git Build the project : colcon build
docs.title: Building the Workspace

docs.text: To automatically source your workspace setup each time you open a terminal, add the following lines to your ~/.bashrc file : source ~/jeteja_ws/install/setup.py source /opt/ros/humble/install/setup.py
docs.title: Simplify Access for Future Sessions

docs.text: Using tensorflow Pull the NVIDIA Docker Image for TensorFlow + ML docker pull nvcr.io/nvidia/l4t-ml:r35.2.1-py3 Run the Docker Container docker run --runtime nvidia -it --rm \ -v /path/to/your/ros/workspace:/workspace \ nvcr.io/nvidia/l4t-ml:r35.2.1-py3 Run the Docker Container and set working directory docker run --runtime nvidia -it --rm \ -v ~/jeteja_robot:/workspace \ -w /workspace \ nvcr.io/nvidia/l4t-ml:r35.2.1-py3 Possible issue fixes Set OpenMP Environment Variable export LD_PRELOAD=/usr/lib/aarch64-linux-gnu/libgomp.so.1 Enable TensorFlow’s cuda_malloc_async Allocator export TF_GPU_ALLOCATOR=cuda_malloc_async
docs.title: Progress Log

docs.text: Updating this github page be on master branch write changes / commit changes in root of github repository, execute mkdocs gh-deploy Updating .md files content goes here to display those pages and make style changes, be sure to include them on the mkdocs.yml file
docs.title: Updating this Site
